name: Upward Salute
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
Slowly sweep your arms out to the sides and up overhead.
Keep your hands shoulder-width apart and reach toward the ceiling.
Relax your shoulders and gaze slightly upward.
tips: Press your feet firmly into the floor and distribute your weight evenly.
Engage your core to avoid arching your lower back.
modifications: To reduce intensity, place your hands behind your head or on your hips.
benefits: Abdomen, Lats, Chest, Shoulders, Obliques, Upper Back, Spine

name: Standing Forward Bend
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Breathe in and extend your arms overhead to lengthen your spine.
Breathe out and slowly fold forward from the hips, allowing your upper body to hang down.
Hold your thighs and let your head and arms hang loosely.
tips: Distribute your weight evenly between your heels and the balls of your feet.
Prioritize lengthening your spine over touching the floor.
modifications: Bend your knees more deeply to protect your back.
Place a block or chair under your elbows if you cannot reach the floor.
benefits: Glutes, Lower Back, Hamstrings, Hips, Shoulders, Calves

name: Upward-Facing Dog
instructions: Lie face down with legs extended and hands under your shoulders.
Press through your palms with straight arms to lift your chest and legs off the ground.
Raise your chest, relax your shoulders, and gaze slightly upward.
tips: Only the tops of your feet and your palms should contact the floor.
Keep your arms straight without locking your elbows.
modifications: To reduce intensity, keep your thighs on the floor.

name: Child's Pose
instructions: Begin on hands and knees in a tabletop position.
Widen your knees and bring your big toes together to touch.
Sit back onto your heels, then reach forward with your hands and lower your chest toward the floor.
Relax your hips and rest your forehead on the floor.
tips: Walk your fingertips forward to deepen the stretch.
Allow your chest to sink towards the floor.
modifications: To reduce intensity, keep your knees closer together.
If your forehead doesn't reach the floor, rest it on a block or folded blanket.
benefits: Ankles, Lower Back, Hips, Shoulders, Shins, Feet

name: Knees-to-chest
instructions: Lie on your back with legs extended and arms at your sides.
Bend your knees and bring them toward your chest.
Hug your shins with your arms and gently pull them closer.
tips: Let your head and neck relax on the floor.
Press your lower back into the floor.
modifications: If reaching your shins is difficult, wrap your arms behind your thighs instead.

name: Legs Up the Wall
instructions: Sit on the floor with the side of your hip touching the wall.
Lie back and swing your legs up onto the wall in one smooth motion.
Slide your hips as close to the wall as comfortable and extend your legs straight up.
Rest your arms by your sides with your palms facing up.
tips: Keep your legs relaxed and avoid locking your knees.
modifications: If your hamstrings are tight, move your hips slightly away from the wall.
Place a cushion or folded blanket under your hips for extra support.

name: Downward-Facing Dog
instructions: Begin on hands and knees in a tabletop position.
Tuck your toes under, press your palms into the floor, and extend your arms and legs to lift your hips up and back.
Push your chest toward your thighs and your heels toward the floor.
tips: Relax your shoulders and let your head hang between your arms.
Distribute your weight evenly between hands and feet.
Keep a slight bend in your knees to avoid hyperextension.
modifications: For less intensity, bend your knees more or place your hands on the edge of a chair.
To reduce pressure on your wrists, place your forearms on the floor or use a block under your hands.
benefits: Glutes, Lower Back, Hamstrings, Shoulders, Calves

name: Lunge
instructions: Begin in a kneeling position with your arms at your sides.
Step one foot forward, placing it flat on the floor in front of you.
Push your hips forward and raise your arms overhead.
Lift your chest and reach toward the ceiling.
tips: Keep your front knee stable and align it directly above your ankle.
Engage your back leg, pressing the top of your foot into the floor.
Keep your torso upright and avoid arching your lower back.
modifications: To reduce intensity, keep your hands on your front thigh.
Place a towel or cushion under your back knee for support.
Hold onto a wall or chair for balance if needed.
benefits: Abdomen, Lower Back, Quadriceps, Hips, Psoas
